The shuffling dead are silenced - we have claimed dominion over the Ruins once more!
Pallid light filters its way through the rotting boughs...let us press on!
The twisting tunnels no longer exhale the toxic stench of degeneracy...
The frothing waters subside; the advantage is ours!
A new enemy - insipid and incurable.
Tonight, the fools make merry. Tomorrow, they die laughing.
The shadows hide the guilty and guilt-ridden alike...
To the resourceful thief, burials are merely... ephemeral affairs.
Strength, purpose, and peace - all can be found in the focused mind.
Competition fosters skill and confidence...
Seditionists and heretics skulk in the alleys - they must be found out!
The man is slave to the beast, and the beast is slave to the moon.
Behold - righteousness and zealotry - gleaming in the morning sun.
Risk and reward - a siren's call to the enterprising stalker.
Let the organ notes ring out from the Abbey - the Sisters are gathering...
There will be no sleep tonight - the wild shouts and frantic drumming will see to that.
They meet in secret, that none may know the horrifying depths of their inquiries.
Cast out from the 'civilized' world, these men may yet be of use to us.
There is, indeed, no better place for those in search of rarities and forgotten lore...
A ray of sunlight. A beacon of golden hope.
Windows and doors will be bolted. Tonight, something haunts the dark.
A troubling shortage of ale...and a notable absence of good humour.
The beating heart of the gambling hall - now bloodless and still.
Any evidence of excessive exertions must be made scarce. After all, apearances must be maintained...
Ancient and crumbling, the Abbey's masonry fares no better than the faith of its congregation.
Woe to the sheep, for does the absence of the shepherd not invite the wolves?
No amount of scrubbing can remove the stains of such fearsome piety.
Surplus - a rare and wonderful thing!
What little there is must suffice, for the time being.
A modest offering from those few surrounding farms yet untouched by the spreading calamity.
Their customs are curious, and their generosity is notoriously short-lived.
Back across the styx - Boatman be damned!
Life...the greatest treasure of all.
No rest, no peace for this wretched soul.
Take advantage of this faith-fueled charity - it will not last.
Death and demise - cause for celebration!
The preponderance of rare and exotic injuries make this place perfect for the study of suffering.
Let each help the other, and in so doing, help themselves...
A fever of wilfull determination sweeps through the barracks!
Your soldiers' minds are mired in malignancy - fear has taken root!
An exquisite example of craftsmanship... and futility.
A finely crafted instrument of butchery and bloodshed - yours for the taking.
Even these dirt-covered dullards have their uses - put them to work!
Perhaps things are not as bad as they seem... (laughter)
Finally the serum is working, and the side-effects are... manageable.
Flames on the horizon, sulfur in the air - the wolves are at the door!
The town is alive with wild merriment and desperate jubilation!
fell to the hand of an ally!
One hero must be sacrificed to hold back the Brigand's advance. Really abandon quest?

By ignoring the Brigand Incursion event, you are allowing your Hamlet to be razed!  Several building upgrades will be destroyed as Vvulf and his men mercilessly pillage the township.
You must battle the merciless Brigands amidst crumbling buildings and rampant structure fires - this is not an easy task. Retreating will result in the death of one of your heroes.

"Hear Ye, Hear Ye!"
Silence in the Crypts
"Reports from the hill cottages confirm a welcome reduction in the general aire of malaise in and around the old Ruins."
Sunshine in the Thicket
"Wholesome plant life has been spotted in the surrounding wood - a rarity in these parts."
Fresh Air in the Tunnels
"West side residents have expressed relief at the abatement of the nauseating odour emanating from the ancient aqueducts."
Gentle Tide
"Superstitious mariners rejoiced earlier today at news that unspeakable eldritch evils no longer threaten their cargo."
The Plague
"The shadow of sickness and disease has cast itself upon our Hamlet, and with it - panic."
Idle Busking
"The music itself is damnably familiar, and yet, strangely unplaceable. Is it the instrument's odd tuning, or some inhuman quality in the bard's fingers?"
Laying Low
"In the ensuing melee, two of the men escaped the scene and are said to be at large. They are most assuredly armed, dangerous, and desperate."
Eat the Rich
"Most curious of all, however, is the absence of any evidence in the crypt itself.  Nevertheless, the chest was found open, its contents conspicuously missing."
Militia Training
"The veteran Sergeant will be demonstrating his training regimen at the Guild Hall every night for the next week. All those concerned with self-preservation are encouraged to attend."
Archery Tournament
"The keenest eye and steadiest hand will prevail during this week's tournament. The winner will claim the coveted Caretaker's Cup."
Rats Among Us
"Threats to our collective safety are never in short supply, but this week our local constabulary recieved a welcome augmentation..."
A Gibbous Moon
"...and it is during such lunar phases that many residents report shrieks and howls of the most profoundly unnerving quality."
Call of the Crusade
"...inexplicably however, only two have arrived. It appears that the Abbot's earnest appeal has been answered, albeit with mocking cruelty."
Rumour of Riches
"Quiet and reserved, these men are professionals, compelled not by the scent of blood, but rather the gleam of gold."
Holy Gathering
"The Sisters of St. Martha's will lead the service with a chorus of 'We Are the Flame', after which they will be accepting confessions in the lower hall."
Revelry
"Debaucherous and decadent in the extreme, several nomadic warriors have wandered into the Hamlet in search of a glorious death. We can only hope they find it quickly."
Wyrd Council
"While strange utterances and unsettling chants typically characterize such events, we have been assured there is no real danger present in the rituals themselves."
Leper Colony
"One cannot help but admire these unfortunate souls - they bear their burden with a grace and humility seldom seen in the able-bodied."
Antique Roadshow
"...the recently recovered cache has excited local enthusiasts, and drawn the attention of experts in the neighboring regions."
A Ray of Sunlight
"This pleasant weather comes as a welcome change, particularly for those currently enjoying a period of convalescence."
The Miserable Dark
"...as one man put it, "Somethin' ain't right with them shadows - movin' and twistin' as they do.".  Residents are advised to stay indoors until daybreak."
Empty Kegs
"Ironically, those most vocal concerning the current dearth of spirits and mead are the same patrons whose unrestrained exuberance the night before exhausted the supply."
Daylight Robbery
"Operations will be suspended temporarily, but given the limited avenues of egress from the Hamlet, officials are optimistic the thieves will be apprehended shortly."
Laundry Day
"Bedsheets and pillowcases gleam white on the line, their lascivious history easily erased, unlike the consciences of those who sullied them."
Noisy Repairs
"Indeed, the elements have not been kind to the old Abbey; the very soil itself seems to reject the place. Work is expected to last through the week."
Absent Abbot
"The Abbot has sequestered himself in the wine cellar, ostensibly to consider how best to help his parisioners cope with the deluge of godless horrors that plague these lands."
Cell Cleaning
"The Abbot will not comment on the condition of the Penance Hall at this time, except to say that he expects normal operations to be resumed shortly."
Supply Run
"Met at the bridge by a jubilant crowd, the Caretaker credits a thick fog and an early departure time for the wagon's safe arrival."
Bumper Crop
"Nearby farmers have banded together, increasing security in an effort to protect the healthy livestock and crops upon which the Hamlet depends."
Lost Shipment
"Yet another cargo vessel has sunk off the coast, and the surviving crew have proven distressingly evasive concerning the particulars of this latest nautical nightmare."
Nomad New Year
"The collection is indeed impressive, and all the more appealing when one takes notice of the discounted prices."
All Saints Day
"The Abbey will be decorated for the duration of the event, and all are welcome to visit during the extended hours."
Mardis Gras
"The Tavern will be open later than normal throughout the celebration, and residents are asked to maintain some semblance of decorum when leaving after midnight."
Caregivers Convention
"Among the visiting delegation are experts in corporeal and cognitive disability, as well as several forensic specialists."
Town Fair
"The town is alight with a spirit of goodwill and revelry, but this life-affirming attitude is not predicted to last long."
From Beyond
"By hateful curse or malign miracle, it seems even death may be defied in this damnable place. Only ONE of these soldiers can be returned to the living..."
Helping Hand
"Putting ego aside does not come easily to such seasoned survivors, but the new recruits are palpably grateful for the assistance."
A Job Well Done
"He stayed up working for days, inspired by the rare quality of his materials, and determined to do them justice with his own skill."
Lost and Found
"In the end, the hours of rooting through the old barrels and forgotten weapon racks bore fruit!"
Labour Force
"Historically, seasonal labourers have been loath to make the journey along the Old Road, but harsh economic conditions have driven them to desperation."
One Good Week
"...and while the campaign continues to drag on, recent events have emboldened the standing roster. Confidence is reported to be at an all-time high."
Medical Breakthrough
"The time and gold were not spent in vain, however, as today caregivers announced they have succeeded in concocting an effective antidote."
The Dark is Rising
"Despondency and ambivalence seem to be on the wind. Many adventurers confess to having a troubled disposition, even here, in the relative safety of the Hamlet"
Valiant Spirit
"They were a fearsome lot - gritted teeth, distant stares; and between them, an unbreakable bond of fellowship."
Brigand Incursion!
"To arms! A Brigand raiding party is descending upon the Hamlet with explosive fury and murderous intent! "

The Hamlet crumbles! An impasse of freshly fallen stone & splintered wooden beams.
Aha - a full glass!  Good news at last!
hic! My liver - as doomed as the Hamlet - hahah!
hic! Chance and fate - one and the same!
I bet the news is bad tomorrow - call it a hunch.
Feh - get gone and leave me to myself!
I...I wish only to lie here for a spell.
hic!
Gods and men. Gods are men. Gobs of men...hehehahahaa!
Quiet, damn you!  It's so hard to nap with all this chanting!
hic!  They pray with their bibles, while I pray with my flask!
I lash the sorrow away!  See it run red down the drain...
Open the scabs once more, for I am a shameful thing.

(Not Enough Food)
I've made a huge mistake.
ACC
Short for "accuracy". Base chance to hit is ACC minus the enemy's DODGE.
Activity Log
A log of major events that occur at the Estate each week. Can be accessed while in the Hamlet.
Affliction

A temporary condition that may be triggered when a hero reaches 100 stress. Afflicted heroes act on their own and suffer stat penalties. Afflictions can be cured in town by reducing the hero's stress at the Abbey or the Tavern.
Antivenom
A type of provision used to remove Blight. It also has uses on many dungeon curios.
Armor
A hero's armor determines her base DODGE and MAX HP. Armor can be upgraded at the Blacksmith.
Bandage
A type of provision used to remove Bleed. It also has uses on many dungeon curios.
Bleed
Heroes or enemies with Bleed take damage each combat round or hallway step. It will eventually go away but can be cured early with bandages, combat skills, and Camping skills.
Blight
Heroes or enemies with Blight take damage each combat round or hallway step. It will eventually go away but can be cured early with antivenom, combat skills, and Camping skills.
Buff
A temporary stat increase.
Bust
An heirloom typically found in the Ruins. Used to upgrade buildings in Town.
Camping Skill
An ability used by a hero during Camping.
Combat Skill
An ability used by a hero during combat.
Corpse

Most dead monsters leave a temporary corpse. Corpses preserve the enemy order for a time and require heroes to use skills to attack around the corpses, move other enemies in reach, and so on. Alternatively, corpses can be attacked and cleared manually.
Crest
An heirloom found in all dungeons. Used to upgrade buildings in Town.
CRIT
Short for "critical hit chance". Critical hits do extra damage and provide stress relief (when a hero crits) or stress damage (when a monster crits).
Death Blow
A hit taken by a hero on Death's Door that permanently kills the hero.
Death's Door
A hero with 0 HP is at Death's Door. Each subsequent hit taken while at Death's Door has a chance of permanently killing the hero.
Debuff
A temporary stat decrease.
Debuff Resistance
Bonus towards resisting incoming debuffs.
Deed
An heirloom typically found in the Weald. Used to upgrade buildings in Town.
Disease
A temporary sickness that debilitates the hero in some way. Can be cured by some combat skills or Camping skills, but usually needs treated in town at the Sanitarium.
DMG
Short for "damage". Determines how many health points, or HP, are removed from the target if an attack connects.
DODGE
Dodge gets removed from the enemy's Accuracy to determine base chance to hit.
Equipment
Commonly refers to the weapon and armor equipped to a hero, but can also include Trinkets. Weapons and armor cannot be unequipped but can be upgraded.
Food
A type of provision used for Camping meals and other meals while wandering. Can be fed individually to a hero for a small boost in HP.
Gold
The basic currency of the Estate. Used to purchase Trinkets, learn and upgrade skills, and upgrade Equipment.
Heart Attack
A heart attack occurs when a hero reaches 200 stress. This will drop a hero to Death's Door, or kill one already there.
Heirloom
A special currency type that is most often used to upgrade buildings in Town. There are four types of Heirlooms: Busts, Deeds, Portraits, and Crests.
Holy Water
A type of provision used to temporarily increase a hero's resistances. Also can be used on dungeon curios.
HP
Short for "health points". HP is removed as damage is taken. A hero with 0 HP is at Death's Door.
MAX HP
Short for "maximum health points".
Medicinal Herbs
A type of provision used to cure a hero's combat debuffs. Also can be used on dungeon curios.
Move (effect)
An effect that moves the target forward or backward in the party lineup.
Move Resistance
Bonus towards resisting enemy moves that cause a position change.
Obstacle
An object found in dungeons that impedes the party's progress. They can be removed by hand or with a Shovel. Clearing an obstacle by hand inflicts DMG and stress on the entire party.
Portrait
An heirloom typically found in the Warrens. Used to upgrade buildings in Town.
PROT
Short for "protection". Indicates what percentage of incoming damage is mitigated. DOTs (bleed, blight) ignore PROT.
Provision
An item that can be added to the player's inventory before embarking on a quest.
Quirk
A character trait on a hero. Quirks can be beneficial (positive) or hindering (negative). Heroes may start with some quirks but acquire more through adventuring.
Resistance
A stat that influences how likely a hero is to resist a particular status, such as Stun or Bleed.
Resolve Level

The veteran level of a hero. A hero with higher Resolve Level can better resist stress, learn higher level skills and wield higher level equipment. Higher Resolve Level heroes will not waste their time on lower level quests. Low Resolve Level heroes adventuring in higher level dungeons will find it more stressful.
Resolve XP
Earning Resolve XP progresses a hero towards the next Resolve Level. Resolve XP can only be earned by completing quests. Heroes do not earn Resolve XP if they abandon or fail quests.
Roster
The collection of all the player's hired heroes.
Shovel
A type of provision. Used to clear obstacles to prevent taking DMG and stress.
Skeleton Key
A type of provision used on curios in dungeons.
SPD
Short for "speed". Speed influences the order in which combatants act. Initiative is re-rolled each round.
Stress
Accrues as heroes travel through dungeons and engage in combat. When a hero reaches 100 stress, she acquires either an Affliction or a Virtue. At 200 stress, the hero suffers a heart attack.
Stun
An effect that forces the hero or enemy to pass on his/her next turn.
Stun Resistance
Bonus towards resisting stunning attacks.
Torch
A type of provision. Used to increase the current torchlight within a dungeon.
Torchlight
The amount of light in a dungeon. Adventuring in brightness is safer but less rewarding, while adventuring in darknesss is more dangerous but more rewarding. Can be increased by using torches.
Trap Resistance
A bonus towards avoiding or disarming traps.
Virtue
A temporary condition of increased effectiveness that a hero acquires after passing an Affliction Check. Virtued heroes have buffs and may buff or otherwise increase the power of their allies.
Weapon
A type of equipment used by a hero to combat the dangers found in dungeons. A hero's weapon determines his/her base DMG, CRIT and SPD. Weapons can be upgraded at the Blacksmith.
Affliction Check
Made whenever a hero reaches 100 Stress and results in an Affliction or Virtue state.
Surprise Check
Made at the beginning of each battle to determine which group is surprised. Surprised heroes have their order jumbled. Surprised enemies act last in the round.
Affliction History
A hidden log of which Afflictions a particular hero has a tendency to develop.
Curio
An interactive prop found in a dungeon hallway or room.

The Old Road
Find your way to the Hamlet...
Kill the Necromancer
A Necromancer is performing unspeakable rituals in the shattered halls of your ancestral home. It must be stopped.
Hunt the Necromancer
Deep within the shattered vaults of your ancestral home, a Necromancer is performing unspeakable rituals… even raising the dead! It must be stopped.
Kill the Necromancer Apprentice
A Necromancer is performing unspeakable rituals in the shattered halls of your ancestral home… it must be stopped.
Kill the Necromancer

Kill the Necromancer Lord

Kill the Wizened Hag
Snapped bones and tanned human hides are the spoor of a vile cannibalistic hag. For all that is good, destroy her.
Kill the Hag
Snapped bones and tanned human hides are the spoor of a vile cannibalistic hag. For all that is good, destroy her.
Kill the Hag Witch

Kill the Swine Prince
A broken adventurer tells of a beast so unspeakable and terrible that the swinefolk have made it their Lord. Perhaps it is only rumor and shadow, but this threat cannot be left to fester.
Kill the Swine King

Kill the Swine God

Kill the Sonorous Prophet
Raving madman, doom bearer, apocalyptic herald. Whatever his role, there is a sickness in his wild sermons that must be silenced. Dispose of this "Prophet."
Kill the Fulminating Prophet
Raving madman, doom bearer, apocalyptic herald. Whatever his role, there is a sickness in his wild sermons that must be silenced. Dispose of this "Prophet."
Kill the Gibbering Prophet
Raving madman, doom bearer, apocalyptic herald. Whatever his role, there is a sickness in his wild sermons that must be silenced. Dispose of this "Prophet."
Destroy the Brigand 8 Pounder
As long as the thieves and ruffians man a cannon on the Old Road, the Hamlet will be cut off from trade. Demolish this ironwork devil!
Destroy the Brigand 12 Pounder
As long as the thieves and ruffians man a cannon on the Old Road, the Hamlet will be cut off from trade. Demolish this ironwork devil!
Destroy the Brigand 16 Pounder
As long as the thieves and ruffians man a cannon on the Old Road, the Hamlet will be cut off from trade. Demolish this ironwork devil!
Kill the Inchoate Flesh
Some things were never meant to live. Cleanse the sin of the Ancestor's experimentations and put this abomination into the abyss where it belongs.
Kill the Unstable Flesh
Some things were never meant to live. Cleanse the sin of the Ancestor's experimentations and put this abomination into the abyss where it belongs.
Kill the Formless Flesh
Some things were never meant to live. Cleanse the sin of the Ancestor's experimentations and put this abomination into the abyss where it belongs.
Kill the Siren
Haunting melodies and otherworldy bass notes echo from the cliffs beneath the Manor.  Discover the source...and silence it.
Kill the Alluring Siren

Kill the Beguiling Siren

Kill the Sodden Crew
The vengeful wraiths threaten to drag all we've built down into their domain of darkness.  Give them a sailor's death - once and for all!
Kill the Sunken Crew

Scout
Test yourself in the mad realm of your fallen ancestor. Take note of how the creatures have taken over, but don't delve too far.
Explore
Unholy machinations have crushed together hallway and vault. Explore your ancestral home as far as you are able.
Map
Is an apocalypse building? Cinch your packs and delve far, far into the tunnels of your fallen family. Make a map of your expedition.
Skirmish
Unholy abominations turning the Light against itself. Meet them in battle and learn how they fight.
Cleanse
They can be killed. They can be beaten.
Exterminate
There are times for strategy, and times for brute force. Send the undead back to the hells from which they were summoned. All of them.
Reclaim Relics of the Light
When the Estate was overrun, so too were many treasures and symbols of the Light. The Abbot will pay dearly for such relics.
Purify the Altars
The unholy abominations inhabiting the crumbling house have turned beacons of Light into vessels for diabolical worship. Cleanse these altars with Consecrated Essence and bring back the Light.
Scout
Take the Old Road into the wood and then pick any of the dozens of dark paths. Test that path and then return with your heads intact.
Explore
The Old Road is obscured by the corrupted, poisoned overgrowth. Explore and return with a full description of every side path you visit.
Map
The Weald was nearly inscrutable even before the corruption. Now it is nothing but dark mystery. Provision well and mount an expedition to map as much ground as you can.
Skirmish
Beat back the creatures and bandits that endanger traffic on the Old Road.
Cleanse
Infection spreads unless checked. Put a tourniquet on the festering wood by destroying any creature you encounter.
Exterminate
Endless winding paths all arive at the same place: the enemy. Bring war to the Weald.
Stave off Sickness
Many a cart-driver has met their end while traversing the Weald. A king's ransom of medicines was recently abandoned. They would greatly assist in rebuilding this sickly hamlet.
Detoxify the Corpses
Blighted corpses lay strewn about the Old Road, teeming with filth and disease. Journeys to and from the Hamlet pose constant threat of sickness. Destroy this blight with Potent Salve.
Scout
The beast-men spill forth from a thousand gaping holes. Pick one and search its extents.
Explore
Explore the Warrens. With a better understanding of where the creatures are coming from, future raids can target their sources of power.
Map
Gain entry to the network of tunnels and take them to every possible extent you can manage. Return with a complete map.
Skirmish
An exploratory sortie into a mad realm of tunnels. Meet the enemy in battle, and then fade to safety with newfound information.
Cleanse
They can be killed. They can be beaten. Starting now.
Exterminate
The swinefolk are growing in strength and numbers. Cut them like diseased wheat.
We Must Eat
The swine's appetite for comestibles exceeds even their thirst for blood. Winter is always close, and the Hamlet would do well to restock its sparse larder.
Knock Down the Shrines
The beast-men have erected crude and dirty shrines to their pagan Gods. Knock them down with pick-axe and might and impede their worship!
Scout
Scout the unwholesome rocky formations beneath the Manor for signs of life.
Explore
Plunge into forgotten grottos and assess the cancerous extent of the fishfolk's domain.
Map
Follow every cavern and grotto to its conclusion and discover from whence the malign currents flow.
Skirmish
A fish on two legs? Test the strength of this new menace.
Cleanse
Take the fight to the waters and show them our landward strength.
Exterminate
This aquatic cult respects nothing but force. Leave a trail of scales and gills and let them dwell on that.
Let Sleeping Evils Lie
Your Ancestor was receiving eldritch relics via marine shipments. Find and return them to town where they can be stored safely out of the hands of greater evils.
Ward Off the Eldritch Tide
The power of the fishfolk grows with every moon!  Light the ancient wards, and drain some of the natural power that they draw upon.

Fear has overwhelmed the hero, whose every thought is now turned to self-preservation.
Wolves lie in wait behind every tree; diseases are in every meal; avarice behind every friend.
Pain is pleasure to the Just, to the Willing, to the Surivor.
Anger flows forth into action. Might is survival. The weak must fall.
“I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.”
Cast off, adrift, in a dark sea amongst jagged rocks.
Two and two make three while six and seven break free.

Powerful spirits will wash the taste of maggots out of my mouth.
Your face and the drinks are all blending together, my liege!
My very soul rests on this throw of the dice! Again!
I wager it all - all of it!
A loveless embrace - what cruel irony!
Such pretty things, my pets, my pets...
Sometimes it's nice to find a quiet spot, that my dark musings go undisturbed.
Peace is acceptance. We are all but playthings of the Gods!
I pray, I beseech - GET ME AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!
Oh Light, burn my soul! Ha ha ha ha ha!
Take my blood as you have taken my mind!  Whoo-hahahaha!
One lash for each of you! No skin shall be left!

Darkest Dungeon is about making the most of a bad situation. Quests will fail or must be abandoned. Heroes will die. And when they die, they stay dead. Progress autosaves constantly, so actions are permanent.

The game expects a lot out of you. How far will you push your adventurers? How much are you willing to risk in your quest to restore the Hamlet? What will you sacrifice to save the life of your favorite hero?
Thankfully, there are always fresh souls arriving on the stage coach, seeking both adventure and fame in the shadow of the...

A brutally efficient single-target executioner and crowd control specialist.  For the Bounty Hunter, planning is key - mark targets for bonus damage or look for opportunties to capitalize on a stunned foe.  He can also wreak havoc on an enemy party's order using his grappling hook, flashbangs and powerful uppercut.

Battle-hardened and stalwart, the Crusader has held the front lines in a hundred holy wars.  He either attacks foes head-on with righteous fury, or embraces a melee support role by leveraging his powerful defensive buffs & off-heals.

The Grave Robber is a versatile and nimble combatant, moving back and forth through the ranks with ease.   She strikes without warning and retreats to the shadows, continuing her assault at range.  If her throwing daggers and poison darts aren't getting the job done, she can return to the melee, buffed and slinging her pickaxe!

Wild, unpredictable, and utterly ruthless, the Hellion thrills to the spilling of blood!  Her massive glaive affords her impressive reach in combat, while its razor sharp edge leaves lasting wounds on enemies.  Certain skills leave her exhausted, however, and she may occasionally need to take a turn to recharge her adrenaline before entering the fray once again.

A rogue, a thug and a thief, the Highwayman has honed his skills with dirk and flintlock to devastating effect.  Whether at range or in a melee, he is equally effective at dispatching his foes.  Be it a grapeshot area-of-effect, or single target bleed, the Highwayman's skills focus solely on dealing damage in a variety of ways.

A lifetime of scholarly inquest into ancient and forbidden lore has opened the Occultist's mind to the powers of the void.  Debilitating curses and maddeningly impossible support skills are his specialty.  The void, however, is an unpredictable power, and consequently skills' effectiveness can vary dramatically, and usually come at a cost of light, or stress.

A doctor, researcher and alchemist who prefers to hang back, eating away at her foes with stacking damage-over-time abilties like toxic clouds & plague-filled grenades.  She is equally effective in a support role, blinding and confusing foes while enhancing a party's survival with damage-increasing tonics, and remedies for bleed and blight effects.

The warrior nun channels her zeal for battle into healing abilities, holy judgements and dazzling explosions of light.  A strong backbone to any party, the Vestal can also hold her own on the front like with a powerful mace bash and close-quarters condemnations.

Combat is a power-ballad - a slow build up, and a grand finale!  On the offense, the Jester leaps to and fro in a bloody cacophony, positioning himself for a glorious end in the front ranks!  Alternatively, he can hang back, delivering chilling melodies and unsettling riffs that terrorize his foes, and give strength to his allies.

A ruined man, a warrior, and a poet.  The Leper is most effective when given a turn to focus himself before raising his massive blade.  When he swings, it is all or nothing - crushing blows and massive damage or the empty whistling of a glancing blow.  He is entirely self-sufficient, drawing strength from his life of trauma, and able to channel it into heals, protection, or unrelenting fury.

A runaway turned soldier, the Arbalest is the definitive backline fighter.  Able to rain suppressing fire down on the enemy, snipe high profile targets and apply powerfully effective first-aid, she is a rallying point, a turret, a beacon in the dark.

The Man-at-Arms is a seasoned veteran of combat, and has been rewarded for his toil with haunting guilt and stoic resilience in equal measure.  Immovable, commanding, and focused, the Man-at-Arms breaks down enemy lines with his mace, buckler, and furious battle cries.

A tough and uncommonly compassionate ex-lawman, the Houndmaster and his faithful Wolfhound work in tandem to bring down their enemies and protect the innocent. Together they stalk the back ranks, bursting forth in a flurry of harrying bleeds, gnashing teeth, and stunning blows.  Should the tide of battle turn, the pair can support an ailing party by protecting the weak, and rallying the stressed.

Beaten, branded and imprisoned for untold decades, this furtive vagrant hides a terrible secret.  The eldritch poison coursing through his veins has given him unspeakable power, at a terrible cost.  As his form changes, so too does his role in combat!

The Bounty Hunter favors a hand-axe and grappling hook, a pairing that allows him to ensnare and execute his quarry with professional efficiency.  His tough leather and scale armor grants decent protection, without sacrificing mobility.

The Crusader wears heavy plate mail and wields a longsword.  While affording him excellent protection and damage, his armor restricts movement, and his sword cannot be swung effectively in the back ranks.
A light coat is all the Graverobber will wear, she favours mobility and dexterity over protection.  Concealed within her garment are razor sharp throwing daggers, and buckled to her back - a pickaxe!

Crude leather and furs may offer little protection, but the Hellion lives to bear the scars of battle proudly.  Her priority is wreaking havoc with her massive glaive and bathing in the blood of her adversaries.

The Highwayman's reinforced overcoat will dull a knife-strike, but he relies more on evasion than damage mitigation.  His flintlock and short sword afford him great versatility; he is never out of position, or caught unawares.

Scholarly robes, better suited to the library than the harsh realities of adventuring, are all the Occultist has brought with him.  His rituals and chants require deft movements of hand and finger, so better he be unencumbered that he may channel the power of his morbid fetish: the polished skull of a dead man.
The Plague Doctor wears only light cloth - intent on remaining as far from melee combat as possible.  From a distance she lobs toxic sachets that can blind, disorient, and eat away at her foes.

Blessed plate mail encases the Vestal as she delivers terrible violence and healing comfort in equal measure.  A mace in one hand, and holy book in the other - a study in contrasts, and all the more effective for it!
Clad only in mildewed cloth, the Jester makes a mockery of battle.  Only a fool would underestimate the vicious bloodletting power of his sharpened sickle, or the discordant throng of his lute.
Heavy and restricting, the Leper's bronzed cuirass can absorb all manner of punishing blow.  His massive sword is slow to swing, but delivers crushing damage to anyone caught in its unstoppable arc.

The Arbalest takes her name from the massive crossbow she carries into battle.  Able to decimate enemies at range with a dizzying array of ammunition, she wears medium plate for increased protection against the volleys she knows are coming...

Clad in the heaviest plate, the Man-at-Arms is a mace-wielding wrecking ball!  Quick to react and adapt, he is most effective leading the charge, protecting his companions with his unbreakable shield.

Still clad in his worn Gendarme's uniform, the Houndmaster's focus is on evasion over mitigation.  His cudgel is an effecive stunning tool, but it is the Hound who delivers the pair's most crippling blows, especially when he's been fed an invigorating snack!

Protected by cursed chains and a thick, leathery hide, the Abomination can withstand the pressures of frontline combat as well as any plated footman.  His terrible claws are each the size of daggers, and his progressive mutation manifests in unspeakable strength, speed, and a profusion of bile.

At camp, like in combat, the Bounty Hunter is all about preparedness.  He can instruct another party member on the nuances of combat, or he can take time to study his notes, bettering his odds against 'big game'.  Scouting ahead can increase a party's knowledge of lurking threats, while tracking increases the party's chance of maintaining the element of surprise.

Righteousness and conviction inspire compelling speeches around the campfire!  In the face of mounting stress, the Crusader is a leader, standing tall and refusing to break.  His unshakable belief can assuage companions' fears, reassuring them that despite the hardships they will most certainly endure, all will be well in the end.

The Grave Robber is restless, and prefers to wander while the party camps, always on the lookout for trinkets and baubles.  She may reluctantly confess to pilfering an item in the Hamlet prior to departure, or entertain those with a similarly morbid sense of humour with a biting and ironic wit.

At camp, the Hellion mutters blasphemies and sharpens her blade, eager to put it to use against the enemy hordes.  Raucous and untamed, she is a study in contrasts - sitting stoically preparing for battle, or pealing with the unhinged laughter of the damned.

The Highwayman relishes cynical preparedness and off-color jokes around the campfire.  A life spent running and hiding has taught him the tenuous benefit of perimeter alarms, and late-night investigations into the encroaching shadows.

At rest, the Occultist will attempt communion with the dark and impossible forces of the void in an effort to strengthen himself and the party. Such efforts are frequently taxing, however, exacting a toll in darkness and stress.

The Plague Doctor makes use of experimental remedies and risky healing practices to cure her companions' ailments, and restore their vigor.  Eager to prove the effectiveness of her latest untested concotion, she will inject herself - blindly faithful in its beneficial results.

Prayers, chants, and blessings bring peace and solace to the Vestal and her party.  She can improve a companion's combat prowess, or instead focus on reducing the group's stress, and making the campsite a safe place for a good night's rest.

A loner and an outcast, the Leper will tend to shun the others in his group, preferring instead to mend his own dying body at the expense of the horror such an undertaking brings forth.  In order to reduce his stress, the Leper can remove his mask, but such a thing is sure to unsettle his companions.

The Jester shines in the flickering light of the campfire, bringing his lute and unerring wit to bear against the fears and stress his companions suffer.  He can inspire greater combat prowess, or raise the group's spirits at the cost of singling out a target for his acrimonious scandalizing.

As on the battlefield, so too at camp.  The Arbalest splits her time at rest, providing expert first aid care, and preparing for the next leg of the journey with optimized marching plans and a fresh, taught bowstring.

The Man-at-Arms seeks to either practice his strict training regimen himself, or teach it to his companions.  Dexterity, damage and unerring accuracy await those fortified enough to endure his lessons.

A clever lawman knows the value of preparedness and information.  To this end, the Houndmaster can send his Wolfhound to scout ahead, or put him on watch to ensure a good night's rest.  If spirits are low, the dog's affectionate companionship can soften the heart, and ease the mind.

The Abomination spends his restful moments lost in the myriad symptoms of his condition.  Pulse-pounding self-buffs provide opprtunities for even greater effectiveness in the next melee, while concentrating on suppressing his terrible impulses can alleviate some of the party's apprehension.
Upgrading the Abbey increases the types of stress treatments and their effectiveness.
Upgrading the Blacksmith allows for purchasing better weapons and armor, and at reduced costs.
Upgrading the Survivalist increases the available Camping skills and reduces their learning cost.
The Graveyard cannot be upgraded.
Upgrading the Guild allows for training of advanced ranks in hero skills.
Upgrading the Nomad Wagon improves the trinket purchase selection and reduces their cost.
Upgrading the Sanitarium allows for more quirk treatment slots and reduces treatment cost.
Upgrading the Stagecoach increases the available heroes for hire each week or increases your roster size.
Upgrading the Tavern increases the types of stress treatments and their effectiveness.

A scholar, researcher, and keen archaeologist, The Antiquarian is not well suited for combat.  She is, however, an expert in self-preservation - by making herself scarce in a fight, or demanding an ally protect her, she ensures her survival.  If direct combat is unavoidable, The Antiquarian can use her fulminating censer to heal and invigorate allies... and to toxify attackers.

The Antiquarian wears no armor to speak of, instead relying on the power of the innumerable ancient charms and relics she has collected in her travels.  Her eye for rarities is enhanced by the unsettling properties of her censer's vapours, which can offer some utility to the party in ...problematic encounters.

A researcher never rests!  The Antiquarian surveys the campsite, obtaining supply items and even trinkets that the party may have overlooked.  Her peculiar utterances and strange powders have been known to put minds at ease, and strengthen corporeal hardiness.

A competitive sharpshooter with little practical experience, the Musketeer excels when enemies remain at a distance.  Her unerring eye and practiced reloading makes her a dependable damage dealer, and her smokescreen, first aid, and skeet shot provide some supportive utility to the party.

Although outwardly inconspicuous, the Musketeer's regalia is reinforced with hardened leather underarmor, allowing her to sustain a considerable amount of focus fire.  Her Musket's variable ammunition and trusty sidearm allow her to deal debilitating damage at range.

The Musketeer understands that her's is a delicate instrument, and must be properly maintained if it to be relied upon in the heat of battle!  She is equally adept and providing first aid to her companions, if only to keep them between her and her targets.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero's {colour_start|notable}image or portrait{colour_end} at any time to bring up a detailed panel showing all of the hero's {colour_start|notable}quirks{colour_end}, {colour_start|notable}skills{colour_end}, and {colour_start|notable}resistances{colour_end}.

After you've completed the requirements of a quest, you have the option to {colour_start|notable}return to town{colour_end} at any time--just {colour_start|notable}click the crest{colour_end}. You don't need to return to the starting room of the dungeon to exit.

The {colour_start|notable}Sanitarium{colour_end} is most often used to remove {colour_start|harmful}negative quirks{colour_end} and treat {colour_start|sanitarium_treatment_disease_entry}diseases{colour_end}. But you can also use it to reinforce a {colour_start|notable}positive quirk{colour_end}, which will lock it into place and prevent new positive quirks from displacing it. You can lock a maximum of 3 positive quirks per hero.

Some monsters have high {colour_start|notable}PROT{colour_end}, which {colour_start|notable}absorbs attack damage{colour_end}. DOTs ({colour_start|pop_text_poison}blight{colour_end} and {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}bleed{colour_end}) ignore PROT and are effective means to take down these highly armored opponents.

Over time, some {colour_start|harmful}negative quirks{colour_end} will lock into place and become {colour_start|notable}severe{colour_end}. Severe{colour_start|harmful} negative quirks{colour_end} cost much more to remove in the Sanitarium.

But always bring some {colour_start|notable}food{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}torches{colour_end}!

For your first short quest, try bringing at least 8 food and 4 torches.

Heroes can only have {colour_start|notable}4 active combat skills{colour_end} at a time. Toggle the skills on and off to change your loadout, and watch how it changes that hero's positional strength in the display above!
Heroes can only have {colour_start|notable}4 Camping skills active{colour_end} at a time. Toggle the skills on and off by clicking on them.

This quest involves {colour_start|notable}Camping{colour_end}, and Camping requires {colour_start|notable}firewood{colour_end}. Firewood is {colour_start|notable}given automatically{colour_end} to you on appropriate quests.

{colour_start|notable}Camping{colour_end} gives heroes a chance to {colour_start|notable}recuperate while in the dungeon{colour_end}. When you are wounded or {colour_start|stressNOT1}stressed{colour_end} and wish to camp, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on the firewood in your inventory.

Camping consists of two parts: {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Skill phase{colour_end}.

During the {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end}, you choose how much they eat, which determines recovery. Make sure you have enough food!

{colour_start|notable}Skill Phase{colour_end} allows you to spend {colour_start|notable}Rest Points{colour_end} on different hero skills used for recuperation.

Heroes relieve {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by taking part in activities at the {colour_start|notable}Tavern{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Abbey{colour_end}. Each activity has different side-effects.

Experiment to find the best activity for each hero, depending on their {colour_start|notable}quirks{colour_end}!

Commiting a hero to an activity {colour_start|notable}locks them in that activity{colour_end} until the {colour_start|notable}next Week{colour_end}. You'll have to take a different hero with you on your next quest.

When heroes {colour_start|notable}can't take the {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} any more{colour_end}, they become {colour_start|harmful}afflicted{colour_end}. This manifests in {colour_start|notable}different behaviors{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}stat changes{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}Afflictions{colour_end} last until you {colour_start|notable}send them to treatment{colour_end} in town, unless you can reduce their {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} to zero during the quest.

Sometimes, heroes respond to the onslaught of {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by becoming {colour_start|notable}heroic{colour_end}!

This elevated state of performance will last until they camp or return to town, and confers {colour_start|notable}stat bonuses{colour_end} and other benefits.

When a hero is reduced to 0 HP, they are at {colour_start|harmful}Death's Door{colour_end}.

While in this state, they will suffer {colour_start|notable}stat penalties{colour_end}, plus any further damage has a {colour_start|notable}chance to kill them{colour_end}.

{colour_start|notable}Heal{colour_end} them to get off {colour_start|deathdoor}Death's Door{colour_end}!

The first of many heroes has given their all in service to you. You have the option of {colour_start|notable}retreating from combat{colour_end} and abandoning this quest to save the others, or {colour_start|notable}press onward{colour_end}.

The choice is yours. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[If this is the tutorial, retreat is unavailable.]{colour_end}

Scouted {colour_start|harmful}traps{colour_end} will be {colour_start|notable}visible on the ground{colour_end} as you approach them. Select a hero and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on the {colour_start|trap}trap{colour_end} to attempt to {colour_start|notable}disarm it{colour_end}.

Some heroes are better than others at disarming.

To enter a {colour_start|notable}door{colour_end}, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[W]{colour_end} when standing in front of it.

Many actions and experiences cause {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} damage appears above heroes' heads, in black type. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} can also be {colour_start|notable}healed{colour_end}, and that appears in white type.

Each hero has room to equip two items, called {colour_start|notable}trinkets{colour_end}. Just {colour_start|notable}drag the trinket{colour_end} from inventory over to the {colour_start|notable}selected hero's slot{colour_end}. {colour_start|notable}Trinkets{colour_end} generally have a trade-off: something good, something bad. Some are also class-specific.

Each quest has {colour_start|notable}different goals and rewards{colour_end}, and each region has its own challenges. Experiment with various combinations to see what works!

However, it's recommended to bring along a {colour_start|notable}Vestal{colour_end} or an {colour_start|notable}Occultist{colour_end} for healing.

Heroes gain {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} for each successful quest. {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} in turn determines the hero's {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end}.

{colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end} represents the hero's veteranship, and directly acts as {colour_start|notable}Stress Resistance{colour_end} against the horrors encountered in the dungeons.

A low {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end} hero that tries a higher level quest will quickly crumble under the unimaginable stresses.

{colour_start|harmful}Stress{colour_end} continues to build beyond the point of {colour_start|harmful}Affliction{colour_end}.

If a hero's stress bar fills a second time completely, their {colour_start|harmful}body will give out{colour_end}. Get them aid or retreat back to town before this happens.

Death awaits us all.
Corpses

When most monsters die, they leave corpses. Corpses act as temporary obstacles and will eventually go away on their own. 

You can attack corpses to destroy them faster, but often a better approach is to use ranged skills, push/pull skills, and even corpse-clearing special skills that some heroes possess. 

Monsters killed with bleed, blight, or crits leave no corpses at all!
You can sell back unwanted trinkets from your Trinket Inventory and make some money.  Open the Trinket Inventory and [SHIFT-CLICK] on any trinket you don't want.
Secret Rooms

A critical scouting success will sometimes reveal a {colour_start|notable}Secret Room{colour_end}!  Advance to the tile marked with a star, and press 'W' or click to enter.  Fabulous wealth and riches await those equipped with a {colour_start|notable}key{colour_end}...

The Ruins bear all the signs of your Ancestor's frenzied digging...
Once-holy idols and shrines have been corrupted to favor pagan gods. Holy Water can help restore them to their rightful condition.
The undead will not bleed, but they can be blighted.
If you live for risk and darkness, by all means bring few torches...

A well-placed supply item can often protect against the hazards of interactive objects you encounter.
You can retreat from combat and even abandon quests. If things are going terribly, live to fight another day.
Skeletons with high PROT are susceptible to blight attacks.

Ancestor
A ghostly premonition presents itself. Is it really him...?
Listen...
I'm boiling!
My flesh... it burns!
Get me out of this infernal cookpot!
I don't want to be eaten!
Aiyeeee! The pain!
Strike the pot! Strike the pot!
I fight for love!
For the tides!
Do not threaten my Queen!
I will live forever here, with my Love!

My eyes clear!
I had the most tranquil dream.
The tides...they took me!

I...I am sorry my friends!
...can't breathe!
The fathoms call me down!
Release me! I cannot swim!
I reject your pact!
The tide washes over me!
Crushing weight...
Those of faith have no tolerance for those with my condition.
I will not serve with this... creature.
GRAAAGGHHH!
Snrrff.
HWRAWRRRRR!
ERRRRAAAAAGHHH!
GWERRRRRRGGHHH!
SHKA-TULURRGHH!
Rrrolf.
IA! IARRRGH!!!
FRRAAAGGNNNN!
EEEEERRROOOARRRGGH!
AARRARRRGGGH!
SKREEEEE!
IT IS UNBEARABLE!
THE SHADOWS COME FOR ME AT LAST!
I KNEW IT!
I COULD NOT BEAR THIS BURDEN!
I SHOULD KILL YOU ALL! I SHOULD--
WHY DID I LET MYSELF COME TO THIS...
ALL IS LOST...
THE MYSTERY, AT LAST!
How can one stand against all of this?
We are doomed!
Oh, justice has failed me!
I... thought death would be honorable...
Where is the white light? I see only blackness...
Why now, facing death, do I crave a different life?
Terrible! ... So terrible!
Caught!  Trapped!
What foolishness brought me here?!
We must go for help! Err... better help than us!
Curses! I should have brought the blunderbuss!
What I would not give for a drop of liquid courage...
I am no stranger to death, but how can one bear these horrors!
I have seen much pain. And yet the thought chills me.
Blood in my eyes... blood in my throat.. blood...
... pulse quickens... humours churn... body reacts...
So this is the death-bed fear, is it?
I am not up to this task, Light forgive me!
I will not fear martyrdom. I will not!
Light, grant me passage through these cursed halls…
Verse XXI: Heathens alone fear death...
Spare me this one time, oh Light. Please spare me...
My mind flies in an empty abyss! So horrible!
I see the blackened vault!  Vast, limitless, terrible!
I feel terror grasping at my soul!
Fear is a mental construct... I must deny it!
My control is fading! It is coming through!
I must away! These morbid paths curdle my blood!
Curses! A blacker fate I dare not imagine!
My mind conjures the baying of wolves! What horrors!
This place suffers not folk as fair as myself! Away, away!
Not but once have I stood in fear as nakedly as this!
Curse this place!
No shame in folding early. I like to keep my winnings.
We've been dealt out! Let us go!
It's a bad hand. That's all there is to it.
No... I will not cower! I WILL NOT!
The elders did not warn me of this...
I...must... concentrate! I cannot be afraid!
It is not so cold. And yet I tremble...
You can do this... You were BORN for this!
Err... Eh heh. Ha. Err....
Ha haaa! Haaaa! Aaaaaaaaah!
Well, so much for bravery.
Some idiot once told me all bravery comes from fear.
Which prancing fop led me down here anyway??
A tunnel carved in ice. A guttering torch.
Swarms of summer larks, fleeing the autumn wind.
All must come to ruin. There is no escape.
Do not resist the end. Anguish is the sure result.
Now we come to it... The vision is cloaked in black.
H-how flawed, my strategy!
We must fall back! We must retreat!
The classic strategems elude me!
Retreat, damn you! RETREAT!
Turn back, we are too far!
I can feel Death's sights on my heart!
The front line will fall!
N-no!  No more!
Nothing can stop these fiends!
Defeat! Despair! DEATH!
Terror overwhelms duty!
The pursuit of Justice leads only to agony and death!
This simple beast fears death as I do.
Let it be swift and painless!
Each step leads deeper into this waking nightmare!
FLEE! FLEE WHILE YOU CAN!
What are we still doing here?! We must leave or PERISH!
Do you not see how our fate is sealed? HOW THE DIE IS CAST?!
My will's iron is bent and my blood is like icewater.
There is no midnight as black as this vision.
My sights shiver, my blood stops!
We are the prey!  This is their hunt!
This is a trap!
Horrors! Unclean sights!
Drop the gold!  Drop the supplies!  Drop everything...and RUN!

I...I would give all my gold to be gone from here!

Even my blade whispers of doom!
Stay where I can see you! I know your mind!
Silence! Demons whisper in the dark...
This is a test of my faith! I sense it!
Persecutors! I live by the law of truth!
This has all been a trap!
I knew I shouldn't have signed that contract...

Stay on the move... stay on the move...

Stop staring at me. I know your mind!
Verse XXV: trust not armed men, for they seek to wound.

I must stay ever-vigilant, lest It take me...

I sense the flick of a viper's tongue. Beware of treachery...

Betrayal... I must cast a keen eye over my shoulder...
I assure you, the worst is far from over.
(growl)
Cut me in proper. Or else.

Streak's about to run dry. You'll see.
hmph...you are all sneaks.

My soul stands out like a flame. I am exposed...

They have the eyes of nervous tigers...
Maybe just cut all their throats... To be sure.

They take me for a fool. ... Fair, I suppose.

Let them stand behind me?! AH HA HA HAAAAA!
Lions in the savanna. A lone campfire.

A white rabbit. Heart pounding, limbs ablaze...
We are not alone here.
They will come for us soon. It is inevitable.
Dissenters - you spoil my tactics!
Eyes down, Private!
They aim to sneak up on us!
Cowards! Finks! Underminers! You are revealed!
Treachery in the ranks!
Surrounded by servants of Darkness!
Which of you bumped my arm?!

Deceive me at your peril!

Corruption seethes around us!

They're out to get me - can feel it in my gut.

I have oft wondered if evil is drawn to my better half.
Hah! One of you presumes to be able to stalk me!
I sense a snake about!
Surround me if you dare!
Something follows! It is near!

Keep away! Stay where I can see you!
Keep your knives in sight! You won't get me!

Let the pain come! I will soak it in!
I revel in despair!
I will bear any wound!
The pain is my penitence!
I'll not avert mine eyes. T'would offend my vows.
The flesh doth test my will. It shall not break it!
To the faithful, scars are but a memento!
Let the pain come! I will soak it in!
I am no shrinking violet when it comes to blood!

No less than I deserve...
Take aim upon me, blackguard! I defy you!

AAAAA-HAAAAA!

Blackguards, all!

OOONWAAARD!

Pace out the halls of your lineage, 
once familar, now foreign.

The fiends must be driven back, and what better 
place to begin than the seat of our noble line?

A devil walks these halls...only the mad

The echoes of his mindless tittering reverbate

Can the defiled be consecrated? Can the fallen find rest?

There is power in symbols. Collect the scrattered

I knew all these paths once; now they

Corruption has soaked the soil, sapping all good life

There is method in the wild corruption here.

The smell of sulfur and gunpowder hangs

Excise the fungal  tumors and the land may yet live.

Our land is remote and unneighbored. Every

To prosecute our war against the Swine,

They breed quickly down there in the dark,

The thing is more terrible than I can describe -

A nameless abomination, a testament to

The Swine draw power from their horrid markings

The fiercest beast will lay down when

These salt-soaked caverns are teeming with pelagic

I always wondered what became of

The poor devils, chained and drowning for eternity...

Towering, fierce, terrible. Nightmare made material!

Twisted and maniacal - a slathering testament

The madman hides there, behind the

A marvel of technology - an engine of destruction!

Even in death, the captain shouts

The shifted corridors and sloped vaults of our

The great Ruins belong to us, and we

Every cleared path and charted route reduces

Paths and roads bring soldiers and supplies,

The swinefolk's labyrinth may yet prove to be navigable.
The twisting tunnels seem a little less ...impossible.

Despite its morbid aspect, this twisted,

We will find all manner of great and terrible 
things in this watery tomb...
More bones returned to rest. Devils remanded to their abyss.
Room by room, hall by hall, we reclaim what is ours.

Driving out corruption is an endless 
battle, but one that must be fought.
The agents of pestilence will yet be driven from our woods!

Some experiments should have never happened.

The pungent odour abates!  The things

At last, wholesome marine life can flourish

Even reanimated bones can fall; even the dead can die again.

A corpse of twisted metal and splintered

The Brigands are undone - our family crest

The wood is still poisoned. The way is still 
blocked. But less people will be eaten.

How many rats will it take to gnaw

The thing is even more horrible in death. 
Liquefaction cannot come soon enough.

Seafaring trade, the lifeblood of any port, can

Finally, a sailor's death for captain and crew. Fitting.

They are cursed to float forever, deep in the swirling 
blackness, far beyond the light's reach.
Tokens of hope, recovered from the encroaching dark.

The Abbot will be grateful - the trappings

These medicines will prevent the outbreak

These tonics and herbs will stave off 
infection and neutralize contagion.

These foodstuffs yield double benefit: the

Our supplies are replenished, the 
soldiers will feast tonight.
This day belongs to the Light!
Beacons in the darkness, stars in the emptiness of the void.

Disinfection, at last.

A setback, but not the end of things.
Wounds to be tended; lessons to be learned.
Regroup. Reassemble. Evil is timeless, after all.
Failure tests the mettle of heart, brain, and body.

Where there is no peril in the task, there

Great is the weapon that cuts on its own.

A death by inches...
Slowly, gently, this is how a life is taken.
Well struck!
A powerful blow!
A devastatating blow!
A singular strike...
A decisive pummeling!
Masterfully executed!
Precision and power!
Impressive!

How quickly the tide turns!
Dazed, reeling, about to break...

A dizzying blow to body and brain!
Unnerved, unbalanced

A hands-breadth from becoming unwound...
Teetering on the brink, facing the abyss!

As life ebbs, terrible vistas of emptiness reveal themselves.
Survival is a tenuous proposition in this sprawling tomb.
More blood soaks the soil, feeding the evil therein.
Another life wasted in the pursuit of glory and gold.
This is no place for the weak, or the foolhardy.
More dust, more ashes, more disappointment.

These nightmarish creatures can 
be felled, they can be beaten!

Remind yourself that overconfidence

A trifling victory, but a victory nonetheless.
This expedition, at least, promises success.
As victories mount, so too will resistance.
Be wary - triumphant pride precipitates a dizzying fall...

Cornered!  Trapped!  And forced to fight on...
No chance for egress - will this be a massacre?
This skirmish may be lost, but the battle may yet be won.
